Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: foxegurl266
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfy, spacious bed, modern decor, Pantene Pro-V shampoo and conditioner, u-shaped shower curtain rod for extra room, good shower water pressure, complimentary USA Today and the local newspaper daily, elliptical and treadmills have individual TVs attached to them, good housekeeping, near lots of restaurants, very quiet Cons: No luggage stand in the room, the complimentary breakfast is pretty sparse and you have to wait for the friendly attendant to bring you items that most hotels already have out like bagels, cream cheese, yogurt, or milk which makes it harder to just grab breakfast and go, no fridge and microwave in the room, no on-wall thermostat

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMarsh72
Reviews.Content: Friendly, quiet and comfortable stay. Just be careful around football weekends.

Reviews.Title: “I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND WILL STAY HERE EVERY TIME I AM IN CHAMPAIGN, IL”
Reviews.Author: arewenotmen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two years ago and was very pleased at that time so I stayed there again on the evening of July 31. I was not disappointed! The lobby was very clean, and the check-in process was efficient. The clerk was very friendly. It was so refreshing to open the door to my room on the third floor, and it had no stale odors, odd odors, or deodorizer smells. I am sensitive to odors and get headaches easily from deodorizer smells. My room smelled wonderfully clean and fresh! I felt comfortable immediately and knew I would rest well here. The room was very clean and well maintained. The bed was extremely comfortable. Towels and lighting were sufficient. There is a little store next to the check-in desk where you can buy sodas, candy, snacks, etc. The location is great--right near the Market Place Mall and other strip malls and big box stores. It is easily accessible from Interstate 74. The checkout process was also smooth. The clerk was very accommodating and held my luggage behind the desk for a couple of hours so that my things would not get hot in the car (The temperature was in the 90s) while I went down to the campus of the University of Illinois. I will definitely be staying here again when I go back to Champaign.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Hotel being renovated but not a problem”
Reviews.Author: miffie98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night on our drive to Minnesota. The hotel was in the middle of a renovation so the lobby & breakfast areas were a bit of a mess. BUT our room was already renovated & it was lovely. And the FREE breakfast was great! There is also an indoor pool - a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a swim meet in town. The room with 2 queen beds was recently remodeled (very nice) and they were remodeling the lobby (mostly finished); they were putting in new tile and wallpaper in the entry. We didn't use the pool, but it looked fine. Breakfast was your standard hotel breakfast. It was not quite as good as the Hampton Inn in town, but fine. We had no problems with noise. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel. Undergoing renovation.”
Reviews.Author: totonka99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an event being held at the nearby U of I. Hotel is being renovated to current Marriott Fairfield Inn standards. Hotel staff was VERY pleasant and responsive, even though there was a large group staying at the hotel making it very busy. Hotel is right off the highway, though we couldn't hear any noise from it in our room. Rooms are clean. Typical Fairfield Inn rooms with 2 Queen beds (some have double beds). Good location to reach the U of I in a few minutes. Pool is small, which is normal for a Fairfield. No exercise facility, though the one across the way at the Courtyard was offered. Not sure if the renovation will include one. Breakfast was just ok with not much of a variety. Probably meager compared to other Fairfields I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was o. k. The location left a...”
Reviews.Author: MarNune
Reviews.Content: The hotel was o. k. The location left a bit to be desired. They had no exercise room, although guests were invited to use the one in the Courtyard across the drive. The breakfast hostess was a bit surly. Not my favorite stop on this trip

Reviews.Title: “Should of stopped at the door....”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Maximum
Reviews.Content: The first clue that the hotel was a fail was that the main customer entry door was manual. Have you ever been to a good hotel that had a manual door? Bed and Breakfast, yes, mainstay hotel, no. This door was not only manual but had a large piece of metal fringing from the bottom. It looked like it should of been replaced, but it stood there in glory. The room was pretty lame. There were no extra blankets or pillows, so that helped with the arctic air temps. The TV was old and needed replacement. The bathroom did have an operational fan. Good. The breakfast was pretty modest, I am sure across the parking lot at the Hilton Garden, that breakfast would of been better. The room did have a great view of the Hilton Garden. So, just to rub it in your face that your room and hotel were lame already, it really gave you the additional notice when you saw the building across the parking lot. The other hotel had a new lobby, ours did not. The cost of the room on a Sunday Night was still 99 bucks. The pool door had a sign that read something like , "no one alone can use the pool room/pool". Wow, that is great. This hotel is Lame, although most in Champaign probably are similar (cannot confirm, nor want to).

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it looks--but it does look very good”
Reviews.Author: NodakTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Champaign partly as a stopping place for the night on a long driving trip, and partly because we are U of I alums. The Fairfield Inn had a pretty good price for advance reservations and it met our needs. The hotel was good, though not as good as it seems, if that makes sense: there were six pillows on each of two queen beds, but I used the pillows as cushions to sit on after my wife and sons had gone to sleep because there was no easy chair in the room (just two straight-back desk chairs). Each bed had a fancy-looking, 3-foot wide quilt strip stretched across the foot of the bed, but it was pretty useless for anything but appearances. That's what I mean by "not as good as it seems": it's trying to be fancy but once you look past the surface it's not really exceptional. It seemed to be a place where people going to conferences in town stayed, or folks in town to do business. For those purposes, and for our own, it was more than adequate and even quite good: comfortable beds, good breakfast (with waffles!), good internet connection. The staffer at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The pool worked well for our boys. The rooms are in good shape and thing seem relatively new or well kept up. It was quiet, but then again we were there on a Tuesday evening. It's a little out of the way, in a small street tucked around and back behind Prospect Ave. a couple of blocks. You can easily see it from the freeway, but getting there is a bit convoluted (again, not as good as it looks?). The largest shopping mall in town is just a couple blocks to the north. The U of Illinois campus is a couple miles away, but fairly easy to get to if you know your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with handicap room”
Reviews.Author: cgoray
Reviews.Content: Bit hard to find , but courteous staff , clean comfortable room and beds , complete satisfaction for handicap needs. Great swimming pool . Sufficient and well stocked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: CaduceusONE
Reviews.Content: Check-In attendent was efficient and courteous. Clean, yet SMALL room. Undesirable interstate noise. Convenient location to restaurants, etc. Overall, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: Chry68
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel online, speedy check-in, & courtious attendant. Room was smaller than I expected and it was noisy thanks to the interstate being right next to hotel. Was clean, but beds seemed to be older and not all that comfortable. Had plenty to do around hotel, and had alot of places to choose from to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HunterLilly
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our 7 month old twins just stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Champaign, IL. When I checked in the I was told "The king suite that you reserved has a funny smell.... would you prefer a different room?" Of course, I said that we would take a different room. The good thing - our new room was on $89 compared to the $119 for the king. No big deal that we got 2 queen beds instead of a king. We were on the 1st floor right next to the pool and ice machine. We did not have any noise from either. It was a typical hotel room - nothing too fancy. It was clean and comfortable. There was a good breakfast in the morning - we had waffles, yogurt, muffins, and coffee. There were lots of other options as well. They provided us with a portable crib for our babies. I would probably stay here again - it's perfect for a one night stay in Champaign.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay - nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Marcy54
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn in Champaign was okay - pretty typical for a Fairfield, which in my opinion are generally not as nice as the Hampton Inns which are usually in the same price range. This hotel is located on the north end of Champaign and is an easy drive to the U of Illinois campus but you need at car to go anywhere from this location. The hotel was clean, looked to be fairly new and the room was fine but nothing special. The light blocking drapes were off the track and would not close completely but that was not really a big deal although it showed a little less than top level care of the facility. The two things that made me give this hotel a lower rating are small but they did differentiate this Fairfield from the Hampton we stayed at the previous night: 1) The breakfast closes at 9 am - and it was cleaned up by 9:15 so if you even wanted a glass of juice after 9, you were out of luck. (The Hampton had breakfast hours til 10.) 2) There is no fitness center at all in the hotel. I have come to expect at least a treadmill and a few weight machines but this hotel has NOTHING and there is no good place nearby for an outdoors walk or run. Overall, it was okay but if I go back to Champaign, I'll check some other properties before booking here again. The rate was not cheap and I think you could do better if you book ahead of time someplace else. (We decided at the last minute to go thru Champaign to see the Illinois campus and most everything else was full.)

Reviews.Title: “A Good Move Over to Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: Pickbent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after transferirig over from a nearby terrible hotel experience (Drury's ). We found the bed and pillows firm and comfortable, the pool clean, well maintained and the hot tub a wonderful 104,quiet & pleasant, the manager even booking a fall hotel reservation well in advance & at a good discount. Very nice, well run place!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelfreek1
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn Champaign is a very nice hotel. There are so many hotels in the area, but with baseball and soccer tournaments almost every weekend, you have no choice but to book your rooms way far in advance. This hotel is located in a major shopping area with TONS of restaurants! It is located right behind the Courtyard by Marriott. (we were going to stay there, but is was more expensive and you had to pay for the full hot bkfst. buffet.) The rate was $94.99/night. They had a free deluxe cont. breakfast which was good, and indoor pool and hot tub, and other standard amenties. The rooms and public areas we saw were very clean! We would definitly return to this hotel if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mary_228
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here with my daughter's soccer team for a tournament. I had made a change to my reservation and it was erroneously cancelled completely. The manager on duty at the time I checked in was extremely apologetic and found me a suitable room at the hotel for no charge! Other than that, they were very accomodating of our group's desire to host a Cinco de Mayo party in the breakfast lounge. For a small fee we rented this space, had use of the microwave, etc. The hotel has a small pool and workout area. The guest rooms were very quiet, and attractively furnished. Instead of a bedspread, the beds were triple sheeted and had a decorative "runner" draped near the bottom of each bed. There were five pillows on each bed, giving everyone something that would suit. The breakfast buffet was poorly laid out, with no plates or flatware near the waffle maker ( my first course). They had bananas and apples, cereal, bagels and muffins. Note: the hotel is very hard to find. When driving down "hotel road", turn in at the Courtyard by Marriott and you'll find the Fairfield Inn behind it ,close to the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary, but great”
Reviews.Author: AmericaWestCMH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn Champaign for one night, and it was great. The property is right off 74, in the heart of the main shopping area by Market Place Mall (though it's mostly all chains, yuck). The front desk let us check in early (12:30), and had a clean room waiting. The room was spacious, but with only a small desk. Bathroom was large, and water pressure good. High-speed internet was easy to connect to and fast, and no worm that I could find as previously mentioned. Breakfast was typical, with a waffle iron for waffles, bagels, cereals, milk in small cartons, fresh fruit, cold yogurt, and all the fixings like peanut butter, jelly, syrup, cream cheese, etc. Overall, it's a nice property, but if I hadn't won a free night, I don't think I would've paid the $80 price.

Reviews.Title: “Room was alright, Breakfast was Great! Beware of the wireless internet worm.”
Reviews.Author: Hector_in_Florida
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. Internet server had a worm virus as soon as I connected. Good variety of breakfast items.
